titleInfo.title: Account document No. 10 for Captain J. E. Ray

name.namePart: Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office

location.physicalLocation: Tennessee Historical Society Civil War Collection, 1860-1982

subject.topic: Confederate States of America--Quartermaster General's Office

mods.abstract: Confederate regimental accounting document No. 10, for Captain J. E. Ray, Assistant Quartermaster for the 4th and 5th Tennessee Regiments, on the account of the Quartermaster's Department in the field for the quarter ending September 30, 1863. Document includes amount of purchases, expenditures, balance due to the government, balance on hand, balance received, and cash received from sales.
mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. relatedItem.abstract: The images found in this section have been gathered from various manuscript collections and offer a glimpse at the wide variety of material available at the Tennessee State Library and Archives that may be of interest to those researching Civil War history and genealogy. These images illustrate the extensive recordkeeping system at work during the Civil War and demonstrate the complex organizational structure needed to handle the massive accumulation of records. From transportation orders to quartermaster records, these items not only provide insight into the soldiersâ€™ lives, they also illustrate the costs of war and sacrifices that were made from all facets of society on both the Confederate and Federal sides...
